title: What are some examples of modernism? - Quora

response.answer_text: As far as literature and poetry goes, classic modernist are Ernest Hemingway, F. Scott Fitzgerald, Virginia Woolf, Gertrude Stein and T. S. Eliot to name a few of my favorites. I personally Recommend Woolf’s “To The Lighthouse” as a modernist novel, Fitzgerald’s “Winter Dreams” as a modernist short story and Eliot’s “Lovesong of J. Alfred Prufrock” as modernist poetry. The modernist movement was largely influenced by existential philosophy (“Existentialism is a Humanism” by Jean Paul Sarte is an excellent read for getting a grasp of modernism) and modern psychology (largely the works of Freud and Jung on the expression of the subconscious). I’d also recommend Alexander Blok, Hart Crane, Joseph Conrad E. E. Cummings, William Faulkner, James Joyce, Franz Kafka, D. H. Lawrence, Wallace Stevens, Dylan Thomas, William Carlos Williams, W. B. Yeats and Hermann Hesse The list, quite literally goes on, List of modernist writers
